data.title: Not new York pizza
data.text: Not bad pizza but not New York style, crust too thick. Travel and have ate New York style pizza in New York Toppings good enough and LG salad is huge. Not bad but to much crust for me. If you like your crust thick it is probably what you might like.

data.title: Best pizza in Carson!
data.text: Every time I order from there, I am pleased.  The pizza is always hot and very tasty.  If you are ordering delivery make sure you ask them to bring the credit card machine as sometimes they don't.

data.title: A slice above the rest!
data.text: Bambino's is right on the border of the cities of Carson & Torrance in the South Bay area of Los Angeles.  I've been popping in there for a slice of pie for some time but it just occurred to me, fellow Trippers: let's share the joy if any of you are visiting our lovely beach area (well, about 5 miles from the beach but considering a lot of you have to fly or drive for hours just to see the ocean, it's a stone's throw!). Basically, the "Bambo's" (as it is affectionately known to us aging surfer-dude regulars) is a place you might see on "Diners, Drive-ins, & Dives". Located in a tiny (read TINY!!!) strip mall next to a liquor store and a few other nondescript businesses, I usually park across the street at the gas station and run in to get my slice(s).  First of all, at a buck a slice (and we're talking BIG slice), you can't go wrong. Secondly, if you are a fan of New Yawk-style thin crust pizza, this family owned & operated little jewel knows the closely guarded secret of the perfect ratio of expertly spiced sauce to cheese.  ROCKIN' !!!  Though I think there are only, like, two tables in the place they do a huge take-out and delivery business. The owner/maestro (sorry, kids, his name is currently swallowed in a JungleBoyJohnny brain-haze) was SO apologetic the other day when I popped in and the usually ready-to-go slices weren't ready yet.  "Sorry, dude," he said in his not-so-slightly thick accent, "We have a huge delivery order we are trying to get out!".  "Not a prob, Maestro.", I said and chilled out.  15 minutes later I walked out with piping hot pieces of N'Yawky pie! They also do lasagna, sandwiches, and a large assortment of other Italian delectables but, and we're always honest here Trippers: I have not tried them.  But if you are in the vicinity and you crave a good slice... I dare you to find better.  And if you do, please let me know.
